sections: Good things are happening! A major name in global energy policy is calling for bold action to address climate change, while the Biden administration is pushing regulators to address climate-related financial risks. Meanwhile, a prominent progressive district attorney trounced a primary challenger who compared Black Lives Matter protestors to “a pack of rabid animals,” while Amazon pledged to keep denying law enforcement access to one of their favorite spy technologies.

The rest of this You Love To See It, exclusive for paid subscribers, is listed below. Become a paid subscriber at the link below to access all of our exclusive content, our podcasts, our live events, and
The Citizens’ Guide To Holding The Powerful Accountable.
Things That You Love To See:
International Energy Agency Recommends Moratorium On New Fossil Fuel Projects

“Hard to overstate how big a deal it is for the IEA of all sources to say new oil and gas development needs to stop *this year* to reach net-zero by 2050 — and how far off it is from even some of the most progressive policy options on the table in the US,”

Biden Signs Sweeping Executive Order on Climate Finance

President Joe Biden signed a sweeping executive order this week calling on financial regulators to develop strategies for mitigating and responding to the risks posed by climate change to the financial sector. The order was

Amazon Extends Moratorium on Police Use of Facial Recognition Tech

: Organizers who have been pressuring Amazon for over a year to extend its moratorium on selling facial recognition technology to the police announced a victory this week, after Amazon announced that it was indefinitely extending one-year moratorium that had been put in place after the police murder of George Floyd.
